page.title: 17SOCIAL LIFE IN HENLLAN (1)
page.content: Youth and Women's Organisations: The Girl Guides,Brownies,Scouts and Cubs have a total membership of c.70. They hold annual camps at Manchester, Cardiff and Harlech. The two youth clubs each possess 40 members aged 11 to 16.They provide ice -skating trips,guest speakers and fac- ilities for table-tennis,volleyball, badminton and darts.The AELWYD youth club caters for Welsh-speakers from Henllan and Llannefydd. Part of its programme is devoted to musical and literary preparation for the annual national Urdd Eisteddfod (a cultural festival for young people up to 25). The Mothers'Union(a church society) the Women's Institute and Merched-y- Wawr (Ladies of the Dawn) contain c.40 members each and meet once a month. They send delegates to annual London conferences to discuss social issues.
